            NA
          
        
      
    
  
     
      
      
        
      
      
      
        
          Evaluation of outliers and influential cases in a multivariate perspective
        
        
        Outliers (i.e., single observations that are distant from the others based on the variables of interest) and influential cases (i.e., single observations with a huge impact on the estimated parameters of a model) are ubiquitous in statistical analyses in psychology. In this course, based on practical examples, we will see how to define, identify, and handle univariate and multivariate outliers as well as influential cases. On a practical level, various statistical methods will be presented using the R software. These methods can easily be extended to other statistical software as well. 
        
        
        
          
            
              Statistics
            
          
            
              outliers
            
          
            
              influential cases
